name: Lady Illmarrow
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Illmarrow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Illmarrow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: Illmarrow's body turns to dust when she drops to 0 hit points, and her equipment is left behind. She gains a new body after 1d10 days, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within two hundred miles of the location at which she was destroyed.

traits.name: Spellcasting
desc: Illmarrow is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). Illmarrow has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch (see "Actions" below), fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
2 (3 slots): blur, detect thoughts, mirror image
3 (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, fireball, fly, lightning bolt
5 (3 slots): cloudkill, cone of cold, hold monster, scrying
6 (2 slots): chain lightning, circle of death, create undead, scrying
7 (2 slots): finger of death, forcecage, prismatic spray
9 (1 slots): power word kill, time stop

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.desc: rs {@hit 15} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Illmarrow's next turn. If the target is undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against Illmarrow until the end of her next turn.

actions.name: Paralyzing Claw
actions.desc: mw {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
actions.desc:
Illmarrow exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature can't regain hit points. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.
A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises at the start of Illmarrow's next turn as a zombie. The zombie acts immediately after Illmarrow in the initiative count and is permanently under her command, following her verbal orders.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow casts a cantrip.

legendary_actions.name: Paralyzing Claw
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow uses her Paralyzing Claw.

legendary_actions.name: Frightening Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow targets up to three creatures she can see within 30 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Illmarrow's Frightening Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Poison Breath (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow recharges her Poison Breath and uses it.

name: Kalaraq Quori
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_resistances: cold, necrotic, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained

traits.name: All-Around Vision
traits.desc: The quori can’t be surprised while it isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The quori can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.desc:
The quori’s spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: arcane eye

3/day each: clairvoyance, confusion, dream, eyebite

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The quori has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quori makes two Soul Binding attacks. Alternatively, it can make four attacks with Arcane Blast.

actions.name: Arcane Blast
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +13 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (1d10 + 7) force damage.

actions.name: Soul Binding
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) necrotic damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points from this attack dies and has its soul imprisoned in one of the quori’s eyes. The target can’t be revived by any means short of a wish spell until the quori is destroyed.

actions.name: Mind Seed (1/Day)
actions.desc:
The quori touches one humanoid, which must succeed on a DC 21 Intelligence saving throw or be cursed. The curse lasts until it’s removed by a remove curse or greater restoration spell.

The cursed target suffers 1 level of exhaustion every 24 hours, and finishing a long rest doesn’t reduce its exhaustion. If the cursed target reaches exhaustion level 6, it doesn’t die; it instead becomes a thrall under the quori’s control, and all its exhaustion is removed. Only the wish spell can free the thrall from this control.

actions.name: Swarm of Eyes (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The quori creates a swarm of spectral eyes that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage, and it is blinded for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t blinded. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 21 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn’t deprive the target of awareness. The quori can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target’s statistics, but doesn’t gain access to the target’s knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

name: Inspired
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Dual Mind
traits.desc: The Inspired has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.desc:
The Inspired’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: mage hand, vicious mockery (see “Actions” below)

1/day each: charm person, dissonant whispers, hex, hold person, mage armor

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Inspired makes two crysteel dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with vicious mockery.

actions.name: Crysteel Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

actions.name: Vicious Mockery (Cantrip)
actions.desc: The Inspired unleashes a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the Inspired, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

name: Magewright
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The magewright’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12). To cast one of its rituals, the magewright must provide additional material components whose value in gold pieces is 20 times the spell’s level. These components are consumed when the ritual is finished. The magewright knows the following spells:

At will: mage hand, prestidigitation

Rituals: knock

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Weight of Sorrow
traits.desc: Any creature, other than you, that starts its turn within 5 feet of the spirit has its speed reduced by 20 feet until the start of that creature's next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Chilling Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d12 + 3 + the spell's level cold damage.

actions.name: Dreadful Scream (1/Day)
actions.desc: The spirit screams. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Aberrant Spirit: Slaad
languages: Deep Speech, understands the languages you speak

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The aberration regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 + 3 + the spell's level slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the aberration's next turn.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The beast has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The beast makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level piercing damage.

name: Fey Spirit: Mirthful
languages: Sylvan, understands the languages you speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fey makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + 3 + the spell's level piercing damage + 1d6 force damage

actions.name: Fey Step (Bonus Action)
actions.desc: The fey magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Then, the fey can force one creature it can see within 10 feet if it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. Unless the save succeeds, the target is charmed by you and the fey for 1 minute or until the target takes any damage.

traits.name: Slippery
traits.desc: Bloody bones are difficult to grapple or snare because of the constant flow of blood and mucus across their bodies. Webs, magic or otherwise, do not affect bloody bones. A bloody bones has tactical advantage to escape from a grapple, and enemies trying to escape from its grapple have tactical disadvantage.

traits.name: Drag with Tendril
traits.desc: As a bonus action, a bloody bones can drag each creature grappled by its tendrils 10 feet directly toward the bloody bones. When a creature grappled by the bloody bones’s tendrils is within 5 feet of the bloody bones, it can be clawed automatically (no attack roll is necessary). The bloody bones’s tendrils can be attacked separately (AC 13); 6 points of slashing damage severs the tendril. This damage affects only the tendril, however, and doesn’t reduce the bloody bones’s hit points. The monster generates a new tendril to replace the severed one at the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: A bloody bones attacks twice with claws or four times with tendrils.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, 1 creature. Hit: 1d8 + 3 slashing damage. This attack hits automatically if the creature is grappled by the bloody bones.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.desc: Melee Attack: +5 to hit (reach 30 ft, one creature). Hit: 1d4 bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled and can be dragged.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the fiend drops to 0 hit points or the spell ends, the fiend explodes, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature takes 2d10 + this spell's level fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The fiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fiend makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d12 + 3 + the spell's level necrotic damage.

name: Construct Spirit: Metal
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the construct or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, takes 1d10 fire damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The construct makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level bludgeoning damage.

name: Expeditious Messenger
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
languages: one language spoken by its creator

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The messenger doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.desc: While the messenger is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Iron Defender
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can’t speak

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.desc: The defender has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.desc: While the defender is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or take an extra 3 (1d6) piercing damage and be grappled (escape DC 13). The defender can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the clawfoot moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the clawfoot can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.desc: The Inspired can cast the fear spell (spell save DC 13), requiring no material components.

1/day each: charm person, dissonant whispers, hex, hold person, mage armor

actions.desc: The Inspired makes two crysteel dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with vicious mockery.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

name: Corrin Delmaco
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Brave
traits.desc: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
traits.desc: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spy makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

languages: Celestial, understands the languages you speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The celestial makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Radiant Mace

actions.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
actions.desc: The celestial touches another creature. The target magically regains hit points equal to 2d8 + the spell's level.

traits.name: Terror Frenzy

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 2d4 + 3 + the spell's level necrotic damage

traits.name: Divine Smite
traits.desc: When the hunter hits with a melee weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to deal an addition 9 (2d8) radiant damage, in addition to the weapon's damage. This damage increases by 1d8 radiant damage per spell slot level above 1st.

traits.name: Vow of Enmity (1/Day)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the hunter utters a vow against a creature it can see within 10 feet. The hunter has advantage on attack rolls against that creature for 1 minute or until the creature falls to 0 hit points or falls unconscious.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc: The hunter is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The hunter has the following paladin spells prepared:< r>1st level (4 slots): bane, detect magic, hunter's mark, shield of faith< r>2nd level (2 slots): hold person, magic weapon, misty step

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Pike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Lay on Hands (2/Day)

reactions.name: Spell Slash
reactions.desc: When a creature within 10 feet of the hunter casts a spell, it can use its reaction to make a weapon attack against that creature. If that creature is concentrating on a spell, it has disadvantage on the saving throw to maintain its concentration.

name: Radiant Idol
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_resistances: radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Aura of False Divinity
traits.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the radiant idol must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, provided the radiant idol isn’t incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the radiant idol. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the saving throw, a creature is immune to this radiant idol’s Aura of False Divinity for 24 hours.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The radiant idol’s spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The radiant idol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: charm person, cure wounds, disguise self, thaumaturgy

1/day each: commune, dominate person, insect plague, mass suggestion, raise dead

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The radiant idol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The radiant idol makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Radiant Strike (1/Day)
actions.desc: The radiant idol chooses a point on the ground it can see within 60 feet of it. A 30-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder of bright light appears there until the start of the radiant idol’s next turn. Each creature in the cylinder when it appears or that ends its turn there must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

As an action, the target can attempt to remove the harpoon with a DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check, taking 1d6 damage per attempt. Alternatively, the target can grasp the harpoon rope and make an opposing Strength (Athletics) check with disadvantage against the bugbear hunter to pull the rope from its hands.

actions.desc: The guardian makes three melee attacks: two with its flail and on with its shield crush.

actions.name: Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage + 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or the next weapon or spell attack it makes is made at disadvantage.

actions.name: Shield Crush
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or the next weapon or spell attack it makes is made at disadvantage.

actions.name: Rapid Assault (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The guardian makes four flail attacks against a single target.

reactions.name: Shield Wall (2/day)
reactions.desc: The guardian raises its shield and projects an ethereal barrier of energy against a ranged spell or weapon attack that it can see. That attack deals no damage. This ability does not work on spells of 5th level or higher.

traits.name: Chaotic Strikes
traits.desc: When the chaos blade rolls a natural 1 or a critical hit with a weapon attack, it can immediately cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Improved Criticals
traits.desc: The spellblade scores a critical hit with its weapon attacks on a roll of 19 or 20.

traits.name: Infused Strikes
traits.desc: The spellblade's weapons are infused with elemental energy and deal 2d6 additional fire damage on hit.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The spellblade is a 6th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The spellblade has the following spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, blade ward, true strike
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, color spray, shield
2nd level (3 slots): blur, hold person, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic, haste

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spellblade makes two shortsword attacks or one shortsword attack and 1 spell.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Action Surge (1/day)
actions.desc: The spellblade makes 3 shortsword attacks.

traits.name: Danger Sense
traits.desc: The zealot has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

traits.name: Rage (2/day)
traits.desc:
As a bonus action, the zealot can enter a rage for 1 minute. While raging, the zealot gains the following benefits:
Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Melee weapon attacks deal an additional damage die.
The zealot gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The zealot is a 6th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The spellblade has the following spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, sacred flame
1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, thunderwave
2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, shatter
3rd level (3 slots): call lightning, sleet storm

traits.name: Thunderbolt Strike
traits.desc: When the zealot deals damage to a large or smaller creature, it can also push it up to 10 feet away from it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spellblade makes three attacks with its warhammer.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage or 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage while raging.

reactions.name: Storm's Wrath (3/day)
reactions.desc: When a creature within 5 feet of the zealot hits it with an attack, it can use its reaction to cause that creature to make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Advanced Telepathy
traits.desc: The flumph can perceive the content of any telepathic communication used within 60 feet of it, and it can’t be surprised by creatures with any form of telepathy.

traits.name: Prone Deficiency
traits.desc: If the flumph is knocked prone, roll a die. On an odd result, the flumph lands upside-down and is incapacitated. At the end of each of its turns, the flumph can make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, righting itself and ending the incapacitated condition if it succeeds.

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.desc: The flumph is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as all divination spells.

actions.name: Tendrils
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 2 (1d4) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

actions.name: Stench Spray
actions.desc: Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from the flumph must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be coated in a foul-smelling liquid. A coated creature exudes a horrible stench for 1d4 hours. The coated creature is poisoned as long as the stench lasts, and other creatures are poisoned while with in 5 feet of the coated creature. A creature can remove the stench on itself by using a short rest to bathe in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Flumph Knight makes two attacks with its tendrils and one with its lance.

actions.name: Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d12) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tendrils
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 2 (1d4) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

actions.name: Stench Spray
actions.desc: Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from the flumph must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be coated in a foul-smelling liquid. A coated creature exudes a horrible stench for 1d4 hours. The coated creature is poisoned as long as the stench lasts, and other creatures are poisoned while with in 5 feet of the coated creature. A creature can remove the stench on itself by using a short rest to bathe in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

actions.name: Acid Storm (3/day)
actions.desc: Acid rain deals (24) 7d6 acid damage in a 20-ft radius cylinder.

reactions.name: Swarm of Tentacles
reactions.desc: Anything that misses an attack against this creature takes 4d4 slashing damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: Papa Drake has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the overlord’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/turn)
traits.desc: The footpad deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the agent that isn’t incapacitated and the agent doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The footpad makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Gar Shatterkeel
damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from non-magical weapons
condition_immunities: water form: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Freeze
traits.desc: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Water Form
traits.desc: Gar can use an action to turn into a being of pure water. While in this form, Gar can fit into gaps as small as 1 inch.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Gar is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following druid spells prepared: 

• Cantrips (at will): mending, resistance, shape water

• 1st level (4 slots): create or destroy water, cure wounds, fog cloud, thunderwave
• 2nd level (3 slots): darkvision, hold person, protection from poison
• 3rd level (3 slots): call lightning, sleet storm, tidal wave
• 4th level (3 slots): control water, ice storm
• 5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

traits.name: Water Walk
traits.desc: Gar can stand and move on liquid surfaces as if they were solid ground.

traits.name: Watery Fall
traits.desc: When Gar drops to 0 hit points, his body collapses into a pool of inky water that rapidly disperses. Anything he was wearing or carrying is left behind.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
traits.desc: If Gar takes cold damage in water form, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Gar makes 3 attacks with Drown, or 2 slam attacks.

actions.name: Control the Seas (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Gar commands the sea life around him to attack an diameter of 15feet. A DC 15 Dexterity check is required or the targeted creatures take 30 (6d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slam (water form)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Drown (human form)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d6 + 6) piercing damage + 1d8 cold damage.

actions.name: Whelm (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc:
Each medium or smaller creature in the elemental's space must make a DC 20 strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 30 (6d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage and is grappled (Escape DC 20). If the saving throw is succesful, the target is pushed back 30 feet. While grappled, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water.
The elemental can grapple up to 2 large creatures at a time. At the start of each of Gar's turns, each target takes 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of Gar can pull a creature or object out by taking an action to make a DC 16 Strength check.

legendary_actions.name: Water Form
legendary_actions.desc: Gar can use an action to turn into a being of pure water. While in this form, Gar can fit into gaps as small as 1 inch.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant hamster makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws, or it can make one swallow attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5ft., 1 target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5ft., 1 target. Hit: # (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc: If the target is of size class small or below, the giant hamster can attempt to put the creature in its cheek pouch. The giant hamster and the creature make contesting grapple checks. If the creature fails, the giant hamster engulfs it and places it in its cheek pouch, dealing 12 (3d6) bludgeoning damage and incapacitating the creature. At the end of each of its turns, the creature may attempt to escape the mouth as it would a grapple. If the giant hamster already has a creature inside its cheek pouch, instead of making any other attacks it may choose to bite down on the creature, dealing 20 (5d6) damage to the creature. A targeted creature as advantage on the saving throw if it has escaped from the giant hamster in the last minute.

name: Imix
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Empowered Attacks
traits.desc: Imix's slam attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

traits.name: Fire Aura
traits.desc: At the start of each of Imix's turns, each creature within 10 feet of him takes 17 (5d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature also takes 17 (5d6) fire damage if it touches Imix or hits him with a melee attack while within 10 feet of him, and a creature takes that damage the first time on a turn that Imix moves into its space. Nonmagical weapons that hit Imix are destroyed by fire immediately after dealing damage to him

traits.name: Fire Form
traits.desc: Imix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. He can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing if fire could pass through that space.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: Imix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Imix's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 

• At will: fireball, wall of fire
• 3/day each: fire storm, haste, teleport

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Imix has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Imix makes two slam attacks or two flame blast attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (5d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Flame Blast
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 250 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (10d6) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Heat Wave
legendary_actions.desc: Imix creates a blast of heat within 300 feet of himself. Each creature in the area in physical contact with metal objects (for example, carrying metal weapons or wearing metal armor) takes 9 (2d8) fire damage. Each creature in the area that isn't resistant or immune to fire damage must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Imix magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Anything Imix is wearing or carrying isn't teleported with him.

legendary_actions.name: Combustion (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Imix causes one creature he can see within 30 feet of him to burst into flames. The target must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 70 (20d6) fire damage and catches fire. A target on fire takes 10 (3d6) fire damage when it starts its turn, and remains on fire until it or another creature takes an action to douse the flames. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't catch fire.

name: Kraken Hatchling
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from non-magical weapons

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee weapon attack: +10 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a medium or small creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover from attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns.
If the kraken takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must save on a DC 25 constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee weapon attack: +10 to hit, reach 15ft, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6+6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple on target.

actions.name: Fling
actions.desc: One medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Lightning Field (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: All creatures within 60 feet of the kraken must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle Attack or Fling
legendary_actions.desc: The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

legendary_actions.name: Release the Kraken (cost 2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The kraken removes any magical effects on itself that reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained, and escapes from any nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

legendary_actions.name: Water Surge (cost 3 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: A strong current surges from the kraken. Each creature within 30 feet of the kraken must succeed on a DC 17 strengt saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from the kraken. On a succes, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from the kraken.

name: Magma Dragon
damage_resistances: fire; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from non-magical weapons
condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Inner Fire
traits.desc: The dragon glows from within, emitting light in a 90ft radius.

traits.name: Snuffed Out
traits.desc: If the dragon takes cold damage, it cannot fly until the end of its next turn. If it is currently flying, it falls to the ground taking 1d6 damage per 10ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Molten Body (Blazing Form)
traits.desc: Whenever the dragon takes a melee attack from a creature, this creature must succeed on a DC10 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes four attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10ft, one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15ft, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10+5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Lava Bomb (Recharge 5-6) [Smoldering, Fuming]
actions.desc: The dragon belches forth a glob of lava at any point within 60 feet, which then explodes in a spray of lava in a 10-foot sphere. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail their saves also take 10 (3d6) fire damage at the end of their next turn.

actions.name: Earthquake Stomp [Smoldering]
actions.desc: The dragon rears up and crashes down, shaking the ground around, while thrashing with its claws and tail. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 14 (4d6 thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the dragon. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t pushed.

actions.name: Shed Embers [Fuming]
actions.desc: While the dragon is airborne, it may thrash around in the air, dropping burning embers, hot lava, and noxious ash below it. The dragon chooses a point within its space. All creatures within a 10-foot radius, 50-foot high cylinder emanating downward from that point must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful one. That cylinder becomes lightly obscured with smoke and ash for one round.

actions.name: Lava Vomit [Blazing]
actions.desc: The dragon vomits forth a wave of lava in a 15-foot cube emanating from the creature. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area remains filled with burning lava for 1 round before it cools and hardens. Any creature that enters the area of the lava for the first time on a turn or ends its turn in the area of the lava takes 14 (4d6) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Paragon Fury
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon may take one additional turn in each round of combat for each of its hit point pools that have been reduced to zero. The dragon determines initiative normally for its first turn, though it gains advantage on the roll. Each subsequent turn the dragon gains is inserted immediately after any one PC’s turn in the initiative order.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: A magma ooze can move through gaps as small as 6 square inches as if it’s difficult terrain.

traits.name: Split
traits.desc:
If an attack does 10 or more slashing damage to a magma ooze, a chunk of the ooze is sliced off and becomes an independent magma ooze. The new ooze has hit points equal to the slashing damage caused by the attack, and the parent ooze’s hit points are reduced by an equal amount (in addition to the damage caused by the attack). 
The new ooze makes one slam attack immediately as a reaction against one adjacent foe, then joins the initiative order at the same point as its parent.

traits.name: Superheated
traits.desc:
The magma ooze's form is extremely hot. Any creature grappled by the ooze takes 2d6 fire damage at the end of both the ooze AND creature's turn.
Additionally, any creature making a melee weapon attack against the ooze must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage + 7 (2d6) fire damage.

name: Nightwalker
languages: Telepathy, can read and understand all language but cannot speak

traits.name: Evil Gaze
traits.desc:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker and the two of them can see each other, the nightwalker can force the creature to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw if the nightcrawler isn’t incapacitated. The creature becomes frightened on a failed save. While frightened the, creature is paralyzed. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A creature that succeeded on a saving throw against the nightwalker’s Evil Gaze is immune to the effect for the next 24 hours. A creature that isn’t surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throws at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can’t see the nightwalker until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

traits.name: Blend with Shadows
traits.desc: The nightshade has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in dim light or darkness.

traits.name: Desecrating Aura
traits.desc: Other undead creatures have resistance to radiant damage and advantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 20 feet of the nightshade.

traits.name: Magical Resistance
traits.desc: The nightshade has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sunlight Aversion
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the nightshade has disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws and ability checks.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The nightcrawler's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (Spellsave DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells:
At will: contagion, blight, darkness, haste, see invisibility
3/day: confusion, hold monster, invisibility
1/day each: cone of cold, finger of death, plane shift

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nightwalker can cast blight. It then makes two slam attacks, then spawns shadows.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spawn Shadows
actions.desc:
The nightshade calls upon the darkness nearby. 1d10 Shadows each arrive in an unoccupied space anywhere within 60 feet of the nightshade, serving the nightshade as allies.
There cannot be more than 10 shadows active at any given time.

name: Ogremoch
condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Empowered Attacks
traits.desc: Ogremoch's slam attacks are treated as magical and adamantine for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

traits.name: Condition Mitigation
traits.desc: Ogremoch can choose to remove a condition from itself by taking 15 damage.

traits.name: Magical Resistance
traits.desc: Ogremoch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Charged Attack
traits.desc: Ogremoch can use a turn to charge any of its attacks, causing it to deal twice as much damage. If the attack is against one target, the attack is made with disadvantage. Area attacks are telegraphed and creatures can move out of their way.

traits.name: Crystal Carapice
traits.desc:
Ogremoch has 10 crystal growths that completely cover his body. Every 20 damage he takes, one of the crystals pulses and shatters. He takes no damage until all of the crystals are removed.
When one of the crystals shatter, anyone within 5ft of Ogremoch must make a DC15 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d8 piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Ogremoch makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Boulder
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 500 ft., one target. Hit: 46 (7d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The boulder is 20ft in diameter and stays in place where it lands.

actions.name: Stomp (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Ogremoch slams its foot down. All creatures within a 20ft radius must succeed on a DC15 Dexterity saving throw or take 4d10+8 bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

legendary_actions.name: Grab and Toss
legendary_actions.desc:
Whenever a creature misses a melee attack against this creature, it can as a legendary reaction make a grapple attempt if it has an open hand. If the grapple attempt succeeds, it can throw the grappled creature to a space within its Strength modifier x 10 ft. The thrown creature can make a DC10 Acrobatics check to land on their feet safely, taking 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 10 ft thrown on a failed save.

If another creature is in that space, then the creature in that space must make a DC12 Dexterity saving throw to dodge, both creatures taking 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 20 ft thrown bludgeoning damage and falling prone on a failed save.

Alternatively, the creature in that space can if they have a free hand make a DC12 Strength saving throw to catch the thrown creature, taking no damage and keeping the thrown creature upright on a success, and both creatures taking 1d6 damage per 10ft and falling prone on a fail.

legendary_actions.name: Mutation
legendary_actions.desc: If a single attack does 20 or damage to Ogremoch, a piece of him breaks off and forms a gargoyle.

name: Olhydra
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Olhydra's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 

• At will: wall of ice
• 3/day: ice storm
• 1/day: storm of vengeance

traits.name: Condition Mitigation
traits.desc: Olhydra can remove part of itself under the effect of a condition, taking 5 hit points in the process and removing the condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Olhydra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Water Form
traits.desc: Olhydra can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. She can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Olhydra makes two slam attacks or two water jet attacks.

actions.name: Form Whirlpool (2 turns)
actions.desc:
Olhydra begins swirling around to form a massive whirlpool. On the next turn, any creature within 50 feet of Olhydra must make a DC 20 Strength check or be swept up into the whirlpool.
At the beginning of their turn, each creature stuck in the whirlpool takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage. Each creature in the whirlpool may repeat the DC20 Strength check to escape. A creature not in the whirlpool may use their turn to help another creature escape, but on failure will also be stuck.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Olhydra can grapple up to four targets. When Olhydra moves, all creatures she is grappling move with her.

actions.name: Water Jet
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is knocked prone if it fails a DC 19 Strength saving throw.

actions.name: Tidal Wave
actions.desc: Olhydra summons a wave of water that crashes down on an area within range. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 8d8 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked prone.

actions.name: Call Upon the Sea
actions.desc:
Olhydra summons a sea creature.
Roll 1d6.
1. 1d6 Reef Sharks
2. 1d6 Chuul
3. 1d6 Water Elemental
4. 1d6 Giant Sharks
5. 1d4 Water Elemental Myrmidons
6. 1d4 Hydras

legendary_actions.name: Morph (Reaction, 1/turn)
legendary_actions.desc: If Olhydra can see a creature attacking it, Olhydra can use its legendary reaction to attempt to dodge the attack. The creature must roll its attack with disadvantage.

legendary_actions.name: Fling (Reaction)
legendary_actions.desc: If a creature that is grappled by Olhydra attacks her, she can fling the creature up to 1d10 + 30 feet away from her, in a direction of her choice. If the flung creature comes into contact with a solid surface, such as a wall or floor, the creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was flung.

legendary_actions.name: Suffocate (Reaction)
legendary_actions.desc:
If a creature fails a check to escape the grapple, Olhydra wraps the creature tightly in bands of water, and it becomes restrained. DC 19 Strength check to escape at the beginning of the creatures turn. Another creature can use its turn to help the creature escape. While restrained, the creature is suffocated.
A suffocated creature has a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier to escape. If it does not escape by that time, it drops to 0 hit points and begins dying.

legendary_actions.name: Water to Acid (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Olhydra transforms her watery body into acid. This effect lasts until Olhydra's next turn. Any creature that comes into contact with Olhydra or hits her with a melee attack while standing within 5 feet of her takes 11 (2d10) acid damage. Any creature grappled by Olhydra takes 22 (4d10) acid damage at the start of its turn.

name: Papa Drake
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (at the start of its first turn)

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: Papa Drake has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the overlord’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Inspiring Presence
traits.desc: Any tribal warriors, berserkers, or tribal heroes within 30 feet that can see and hear the overlord have advantage on their saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the overlord can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Raging
traits.desc: At the start of its first turn, the overlord gains advantage on Strength checks and saving throws, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and a +3 bonus to melee weapon damage rolls (included in the attack).

traits.name: Brutal Critical
traits.desc: The overlord rolls one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Papa Drake makes two weapon attacks with his Battleaxe and one with his shield.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (1d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The king makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Squash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Gourd
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Seed Spit (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The king spits pumpkin seeds in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 damage (10d8) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary_actions.desc: The king can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The king regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Squash
legendary_actions.desc: The king makes a squash attack.

legendary_actions.name: Vine Lash (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The king lashes out with entangling vines. Each enemy creature within 20 feet of the king must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained. A creature restrained by the vines can use its action to make a DC 19 strength check, freeing itself on a success. The vines can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12, hp 20).

legendary_actions.name: Trick or Treat (3 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The king scatters 3 pumpkins, which fall in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the king. The pumpkins use the statblock of a Thorny.

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.desc: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dex saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and half if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The assassin deals an extra 21 (6d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn’t incapacitated and the agent doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Blink (3/day)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, Scarlett can blink in and out of existence. Use the rules for the spell Blink. If she reappears within 5 feet of a hostile creature, she has advantage on her next attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Scarlett makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Con saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Con saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Impale
traits.desc: If the hellbeast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature right before hitting it with a gore attack, the target takes an extra 27 (6d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the rhino can’t impale another target.

traits.name: Impale
traits.desc: If the hellbeast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature right before hitting it with a gore attack, the target takes an extra 27 (6d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the rhino can’t impale another target.

traits.name: Relentless (1/day)
traits.desc: If the hellbeast takes damage that reduces it to 0 hit points, unless the damage is from a critical hit, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Taint Aura
traits.desc: At the start of each of the hellbeast’s turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage unless it is protected by jade. A creature that touches the hellbeast or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hellbeast makes two gore attacks and either hurls a creature or uses its slam attack.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hurl
actions.desc: The hellbeast hurls away a creature it has grappled with its Impale trait. The creature is hurled through the air and lands in an empty space of the hellbeast’s choosing within 30 feet of it. The creature takes falling damage when it hits the ground and lands prone.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The drow assassin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 

• At will: dancing lights, misty step
• 3/day: darkness, Tasha's hideous laughter (choking shadows),
• 1/day: vitriolic sphere, insect plague (spiders)

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.desc: During its first turn, the drow assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Fey Ancestrey
traits.desc: The drow assassin has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic cannot put the assassin to sleep.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the drow assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the drow assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack
traits.desc: Once per turn, the drow assassin deals an extra 24 (7d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow assassin that isn't incapacitated and the drow assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Hard to Hit
traits.desc: If the drow assassin can see the attack, the attack has disadvantage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow assassin makes two ranged attacks, one shortsword attack and one crossbow attack, or three melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Olhydra can grapple up to four targets. When Olhydra moves, all creatures she is grappling move with her.

actions.name: Eagle's Talon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4) piercing damage. An attack made with this dagger while falling transfers double fall damage (2d6 per 10 feet fallen) to the target on a successful hit. Otherwise, fall damage is taken normally.

actions.name: Enchanted Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) piercing damage, plus 17 (5d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls unconcious while poisoned. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

legendary_actions.name: Riposte (Reaction)
legendary_actions.desc: If a creature misses the drow assassin, the assassin can make a melee attack in response.

traits.name: Chained God.
traits.desc: Tharizdun begins the fight chained to the earth by three massive chains. Each round, Tharizdun breaks free of 1 chain. Tharizdun has 1 action for each broken chain.

traits.name: Lord of Annihilation.
traits.desc:
If a target is reduced to 0 hit points by
force damage caused by Tharizdun it is disintegrated and can
only be returned to life by a wish (note this doesn’t apply to
creatures that discorporate or are banished when they reach 0
hit points).

traits.name: Regeneration.
traits.desc:
Tharizdun regains 50 hit points at the start of its
turn. If it takes radiant damage, this trait does not function at
the start of its next turn. Tharizdun is only destroyed if it starts
its turn with 0 hit points and it can’t regenerate.

traits.name: Unstable Magic.
traits.desc: Every spell against Tharizdun has a chance to cause a Wild Magic surge. Roll 1d20, and on a 10 or below, roll on the Wild Magic table.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: Tharizdun makes two druniazth attacks.

actions.name: Druniazth.
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack: +22 to hit, reach 15 ft., one
target. Hit: 50 (6d10 + 17) slashing damage plus 40 force
damage.

actions.name: Chain Whip.
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack: +22 to hit, reach 150 ft., one
target. Hit: 33 (3d10 + 17) bludgeoning damage. If the attack is successful, the target must make a DC 25 Dexterity check or be restrained. 
Each round, Tharizdun tries to pull the creature toward them. Do a Strength contest. If Tharizdun wins, the creature is pulled by ten feet by every 1 they lost by.
The creature can attempt to break free of the chains at the end of its turn by making a DC 25 Strength Check.

actions.name: Disintegrate.
actions.desc:
Tharizdun picks one target he can see at random within
120 feet. The target must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving
throw taking 96 (16d6+40) force damage on a failure.

actions.name: Force Blast.
actions.desc:
Tharizdun emits a blast of force in a 80 foot
cone. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 25 Strength
saving throw or be pushed up to 200 feet and knocked prone.
If a thrown target strikes a solid surface the target takes 3 (1d6)
bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the
target is thrown at another creature, that creature must
succeed on a DC 33 Dexterity saving throw or take the same
damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Word of Annihilation (Recharge 6).
actions.desc:
Tharizdun speaks the
word of annihilation. One random creature within 60 ft. of Tharizdun
must make a DC 25 Constitution saving throw or take 250
(20d20+40) force damage and be stunned until the end of
Tharizdun’s next turn.

reactions.name: Chain Reaction
reactions.desc: On a missed ranged attack, Tharizdun can make a Chain Whip attack.

traits.name: Chill of the Void
traits.desc: Cold damage dealt by the void dragon ignores resistance to cold damage, but not cold immunity.

traits.name: Collapsing Star
traits.desc:
When the void dragon is killed it explodes in a
swath of celestial destruction. Each creature and object within
1 mile of the dragon take 55 (10d10) bludgeoning damage, 55
(10d10) cold damage, and 55 (10d10) psychic damage. Each
damage type can be reduced by half with a successful DC 21
saving throw: Dexterity vs. bludgeoning, Constitution vs. cold,
and Wisdom vs. psychic. Additionally, a creature that fails two
or three of the saving throws is affected by a plane shift spell
and sent to a random plane. If it is sent to the plane it currently
occupies, it appears 5d100 miles away in a random direction.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc:
The dragon can use its Aura of Madness. It then
makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target.
Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.
Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target.
Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Aura of Madness
actions.desc:
Each creature that is
within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed
on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1
minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each
of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature
fails the saving throw by 5 or more it is driven insane. An insane
creature is frightened permanently, and behaves as if affected
by confusion while it is frightened in this way. If a creature’s
saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is
immune to the dragon’s Aura of Madness for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Gravitic Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The dragon exhales a 90-foot cube of
powerful localized gravity, originating from the dragon.
Falling damage in the area increases to 1d10 per 10 feet
fallen. When a creature starts its turn within the area or
enters it for the first time in a turn, including when the
dragon creates the field, it must make a DC 24 Dexterity
saving throw. On a failure the creature is restrained. On
a success the creature’s speed is halved as long as it
remains in the field. A restrained creature repeats the
saving throw at the end of its turn. The field persists
until the dragon’s breath recharges, and it can’t use
gravitic breath twice consecutively.

actions.name: Stellar Flare Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The dragon exhales star fire in
a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must
make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45
(13d6) fire damage and 45 (13d6) radiant damage
on a failed save, or half as much damage on a
successful one.

reactions.name: Void Twist
reactions.desc:
When the dragon is hit by a ranged
attack, it can create a small rift in space to increase
its AC by 2 against that attack. If the attack misses
because of this increase, the dragon can choose a
creature within 30 feet to become the new target for
that attack. Use the original attack roll to determine if
the attack hits the new target.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Void Slip (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc:
The dragon twists the fabric
of space. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must
succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6)
bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can
then teleport to an unoccupied space within 40 feet.

name: Warforged Soldier
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Warforged Resilience
traits.desc: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and is immune to disease. Magic can’t put it to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

actions.name: Armblade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Protection
reactions.desc: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

name: Valenar Hound
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can’t speak

traits.name: Bonding
traits.desc: The hound can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the hound bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hound and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

name: Undying Soldier
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_resistances: radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The soldier magically sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The soldier can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The soldier makes two spear attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage if the target is a fiend or undead.

name: Living Burning Hands
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Magical Strike
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) fire damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The living spell unleashes a thin sheet of flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Clawfoot
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The clawfoot has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the clawfoot's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the clawfoot moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the clawfoot can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The clawfoot makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

name: Dyrrn
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Alien Mind
traits.desc: If a creature tries to read Dyrrn’s thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Dyrrn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Dyrrn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Dyrrn regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If Dyrrn takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. Dyrrn dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

traits.name: Teleport
traits.desc: As a bonus action, Dyrrn can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Dyrrn makes one Tentacle Whip attack and uses its Corruption once. Dyrrn can replace its Tentacle Whip attack with Extract Brain if it has a creature grappled.

actions.name: Tentacle Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 23), pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of Dyrrn, and must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends. Dyrrn can’t use the same tentacle whip on another target until this grapple ends. Dyrrn has two tentacle whips.

actions.name: Corruption
actions.desc:
Dyrrn targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (4d6 + 8) necrotic damage and become corrupted for 1 minute.

A corrupted creature’s flesh twists in alien ways. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, its speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted. The corrupted creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated creature grappled by Dyrrn. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Dyrrn kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

legendary_actions.desc: Dyrrn can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Dyrrn regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle Whip
legendary_actions.desc: Dyrrn makes one attack with its Tentacle Whip.

legendary_actions.name: Spawn Aberration (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Dyrrn regurgitates an intellect devourer in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The intellect devourer is under Dyrrn’s control and acts immediately after Dyrrn in the initiative order.

legendary_actions.name: Mind Blast (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Dyrrn magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or take 30 (5d8 + 8) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Aim
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the Wandslinger gives itself advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. The Wandslingercan use this bonus action only if the Wandslinger hasn't moved during this turn, and after the Wandslinger uses the bonus action, the Wandslinger's speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

traits.name: Wand
traits.desc: The Wandslinger owns a wand which they require as a magic focus to cast their spells; the wand must be held in one hand for that purpose.
