traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc: The Wandslinger is a first-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Wandslinger has the following spells prepared:< r>< r>> __Cantrips (at will):__ prestidigitation, produce flame, fire bolt< r>> __1st level (2 slots):__ burning hands, fog cloud

traits.name: Hogtie
traits.desc: If the Wandslinger has a creature grappled, it can use its bonus action to restrain the creature by hogtieing it. The creature must make a DC 12 dexterity save or be restrained. Once restrained, a DC 17 Strength save is required to break the rope.

actions.name: Firebolt
actions.desc: The Wandslinger hurls a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn’t being worn or carried.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: _Melee Weapon Attack:_ +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. _Hit:_ 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Aim
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the Wandslinger gives itself advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. The Wandslingercan use this bonus action only if the Wandslinger hasn't moved during this turn, and after the Wandslinger uses the bonus action, the Wandslinger's speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

traits.name: Wand
traits.desc: The Wandslinger owns a wand which they require as a magic focus to cast their spells; the wand must be held in one hand for that purpose.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc: The Wandslinger is a first-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Wandslinger has the following spells prepared:< r>< r>> __Cantrips (at will):__ prestidigitation, produce flame, fire bolt< r>> __1st level (2 slots):__ burning hands, fog cloud

traits.name: Hogtie
traits.desc: If the Wandslinger has a creature grappled, it can use its bonus action to restrain the creature by hogtieing it. The creature must make a DC 12 dexterity save or be restrained. Once restrained, a DC 17 Strength save is required to break the rope.

actions.name: Firebolt
actions.desc: The Wandslinger hurls a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn’t being worn or carried.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: _Melee Weapon Attack:_ +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. _Hit:_ 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

name: Changeling
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
languages: Common, Dwarvish, Elvish, Halfling, Thieves' Cant

traits.name: Change Appearance
traits.desc: The changeling can use its action to polymorph into a Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The changeling makes two attacks with its dagger.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Unsettling Visage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: Each creature within 30 feet of the changeling must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Undying Councilor
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Aura of Radiance
traits.desc: The councilor magically sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The councilor can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action. If the bright light overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created that darkness is dispelled.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The councilor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The councilor is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy

1st level (4 slots): bless, command, create or destroy water

2nd level (3 slots): augury, calm emotions, hold person

3rd level (3 slots): daylight, dispel magic, spirit guardians

4th level (3 slots): banishment, divination, guardian of faith

5th level (2 slots): dispel evil and good, flame strike (see “Actions” below), scrying

6th level (1 slot): forbiddance, planar ally

7th level (1 slot): plane shift

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The councilor makes two Radiant Touch attacks.

actions.name: Radiant Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) radiant damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.desc: The councilor touches another creature. The target magically regains 18 (3d8 + 5) hit points and is freed from one curse afflicting it (councilor’s choice).

actions.name: Flame Strike (5th-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
actions.desc: The councilor chooses a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the councilor casts this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (its choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

legendary_actions.desc: The councilor can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The councilor regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary_actions.name: Touch
legendary_actions.desc: The councilor makes one attack with its Radiant Touch.

legendary_actions.name: Shimmering Aura (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The councilor channels positive energy into its Aura of Radiance. Until the end of the councilor’s next turn, it sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Any creature that starts its turn in the bright light must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the councilor’s next turn.

name: Steel Defender
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Might of the Master
traits.desc: The following numbers increase by 1 when your proficiency bonus increases by 1: the defender’s skill and saving throw bonuses (above), the bonuses to hit and damage of its rend attack, and the number of hit points restored by its Repair action (below).

traits.name: Vigilant
traits.desc: The defender can’t be surprised.

traits.name: Steel Defender
traits.desc:
In combat, the steel defender shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take one of the actions in its stat block or the Dash, Disengage, Help, Hide, or Search action.

If the mending spell is cast on it, it regains 2d6 hit points. If it has died within the last hour, you can use your smith’s tools as an action to revive it, provided you are within 5 feet of it and you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. The steel defender returns to life after 1 minute with all its hit points restored.

actions.name: Force-Empowered Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. Hit: 1d8 + 2 force damage.

actions.name: Repair (3/Day)
actions.desc: The magical mechanisms inside the defender restore 2d8 + 2 hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

reactions.name: Deflect Attack
reactions.desc: The defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll of one creature it can see that is within 5 feet of it, provided the attack roll is against a creature other than the defender.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The fiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fiend makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + the spell's level slashing damage. Immediately after the attack hits or misses, the fiend can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Festering Aura
traits.desc: Any creature, other than you, that starts its turn within 5 feet of the spirit must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Rotting Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + 3 + the spell's level slashing damage. If the target is poisoned, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

name: Dusk Hag
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The hag’s spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, disguise self

3/day each: dream, hypnotic pattern, sleep (9d8)

1/day each: legend lore, scrying

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hag makes two Nightmare Touch attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Nightmare Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is unconscious, it takes an extra 10 (3d6) psychic damage and is cursed until the hag dies or the curse is removed. The cursed creature’s hit point maximum decreases by 5 (1d10) whenever it finishes a long rest.

reactions.name: Dream Eater
reactions.desc: When an unconscious creature the hag can see within 30 feet of her regains consciousness, the hag can force the creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage, and the hag regains hit points equal to the amount of damage taken.

name: Tsucora Quori
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.desc:
The quori’s spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: charm person

1/day: fear

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quori makes three attacks: one pincer attack, one attack with its claws, and one stinger attack.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. The quori has two pincers, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d10) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the quori for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn’t deprive the target of awareness. The quori can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target’s statistics, but doesn’t gain access to the target’s knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

name: Inspired (Hashalaq variant)
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Dual Mind
traits.desc: The Inspired has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

traits.name: Suggestion (3/Day)
traits.desc: The Inspired can cast the suggestion spell (spell save DC 13), requiring no material components.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.desc:
The Inspired’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: mage hand, vicious mockery (see “Actions” below)

1/day each: charm person, dissonant whispers, hex, hold person, mage armor

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Inspired makes two crysteel dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with vicious mockery.

actions.name: Crysteel Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

actions.name: Vicious Mockery (Cantrip)
actions.desc: The Inspired unleashes a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the Inspired, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the fiend's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The fiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fiend makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 2d6 + 3 + the spell's level fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

name: Inspired (Kalaraq variant)
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Dual Mind
traits.desc: The Inspired has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

traits.name: All Around Vision
traits.desc: The Inspired can’t be surprised.

traits.name: Arcane Eye (3/Day)
traits.desc: The Inspired can cast the arcane eye spell, requiring no material components.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.desc:
The Inspired’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: mage hand, vicious mockery (see “Actions” below)

1/day each: charm person, dissonant whispers, hex, hold person, mage armor

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Inspired makes two crysteel dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with vicious mockery.

actions.name: Crysteel Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

actions.name: Vicious Mockery (Cantrip)
actions.desc: The Inspired unleashes a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the Inspired, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

name: Warforged Titan
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can’t speak

traits.name: Platforms
traits.desc: The warforged titan has two platforms built into its chassis. One Medium or smaller creature can ride on each platform without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the warforged, they must use spears or weapons with reach and the target must be Large or larger.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The warforged titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warforged titan makes one axehand attack and one hammerfist attack.

actions.name: Axehand
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage, plus 11 (2d10) slashing damage if the target is prone.

actions.name: Hammerfist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Sweeping Axe (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The warforged titan makes a sweep with its axehand, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Dolgaunt
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
senses: Blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), Passive Perception 14

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the dolgaunt is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the dolgaunt instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can’t use this trait if it’s incapacitated.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the dolgaunt is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dolgaunt makes two tentacle attacks and two unarmed strikes. Up to two tentacle attacks can be replaced by Vitality Drain.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 12) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the dolgaunt can’t use the same tentacle on another target. The dolgaunt has two tentacles.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Vitality Drain
actions.desc: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the dolgaunt must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the dolgaunt regains a number of hit points equal to half the necrotic damage taken.

name: Dolgrim
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Dual Consciousness
traits.desc: The dolgrim has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dolgrim makes three attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

name: Warforged Colossus
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_immunities: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Towering Terror
traits.desc: Any enemy outside the colossus that starts its turn within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the enemy’s next turn. If the enemy’s saving throw is successful, it is immune to this colossus’s Towering Terror for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The colossus makes three attacks — one with its slam and two with its eldritch turrets — and then uses Stomp.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the colossus can push the target up to 20 feet away from it.

actions.name: Eldritch Turret
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +18 to hit, range 300 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked prone.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc:
The colossus stomps one of its feet at a point on the ground within 20 feet of it. Any creature in a 20-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on this point must succeed on a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Until the colossus uses its Stomp again or moves, the creature is restrained. While restrained in this way, the creature (or another creature within 5 feet of it) can use its action to make a DC 26 Strength check. On a success, the creature relocates to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the colossus and is no longer restrained.

Structures, as well as nonmagical objects that are neither being worn nor carried, take the same amount of damage if they are in the cylinder (no save).

actions.name: Incinerating Beam (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The colossus fires a beam of light in a 150-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this beam is disintegrated, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The beast has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Water Bearthing
traits.desc: The beast can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The beast makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level piercing damage.

name: Fey Spirit: Tricksy
languages: Sylvan, understands the languages you speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fey makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + 3 + the spell's level piercing damage + 1d6 force damage

actions.name: Fey Step (Bonus Action)
actions.desc: The fey magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Then, the fey can fill a 5-foot cube within 5 feet of it with magical darkness, which lasts until the end of its next turn.

name: Rak Tulkhesh
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Deadly Critical
traits.desc: Rak Tulkhesh scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 and rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Rak Tulkhesh’s spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 24). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect thoughts, dispel magic, spirit guardians

1/day each: banishing smite, blinding smite, staggering smite

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Rak Tulkhesh fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Rak Tulkhesh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Whirlwind of Weapons
traits.desc: A magical aura of weapons surrounds Rak Tulkhesh in a 10 foot radius. At the start of each of his turns, any other creature in the aura takes 14 (4d6) force damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Rak Tulkhesh makes four weapon attacks.

actions.name: Spawned Melee Weapon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage.

actions.name: Spawned Ranged Weapon
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc:
Rak Tulkhesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than his own, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (his choice).

In a new form, Rak Tulkhesh retains his alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.desc: Rak Tulkhesh can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Rak Tulkhesh regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Rak Tulkhesh makes one weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: End Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Rak Tulkhesh casts dispel magic.

legendary_actions.name: Provoke Rage (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of Rak Tulkhesh must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged weapon attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary. This attack is made with advantage and gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.

name: Elemental Spirit: Air
languages: Primordial, understands the languages you speak

traits.name: Amorphous Form
traits.desc: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The elemental makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 + 4 + the spell's level bludgeoning damage.

name: Zakya Rakshasa
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
damage_vulnerabilities: piercing from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The rakshasa’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect thoughts, disguise self

1/day: shield

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.desc: The rakshasa can’t be affected or detected by spells of 1st level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The rakshasa’s weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Martial Prowess (1/Turn)
traits.desc: When the rakshasa hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 11 (2d10) damage of the weapon’s type, and the creature must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the rakshasa can push the creature up to 10 feet away from it, knock the creature prone, or make the creature drop one item it is holding of the rakshasa’s choice.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The rakshasa makes three melee weapon attacks. Alternatively, it can make two ranged attacks with its javelins.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

name: Fastieth
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Quickness (Recharge 5–6)
traits.desc: The fastieth can take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

name: Aberrant Spirit: Star Spawn
languages: Deep Speech, understands the languages you speak

traits.name: Whispering Aura

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 + 4 + the spell's level fire damage.

name: Homunculus Servant
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the homunculus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can’t use this trait if it’s

traits.name: Might of the Master
traits.desc: The following numbers increase by 1 when your proficiency bonus increases by 1: the homunculus’s skill and saving throw bonuses (above) and the bonuses to hit and damage of its attack (below).

actions.name: Force Strike (Requires PC Bonus Action)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30 ft., one target you can see. Hit: 1d4 + 2 force damage.

reactions.name: Channel Magic
reactions.desc: The homunculus delivers a spell you cast that has a range of touch. The homunculus must be within 120 feet of you.

name: Mordakhesh
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
damage_vulnerabilities: piercing from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Mordakhesh’s spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). Mordakhesh can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: chromatic orb (see “Actions” below), detect thoughts, disguise self

1/day each: banishing smite, destructive wave, fly, mass suggestion, staggering smite, suggestion, true seeing

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.desc: Mordakhesh can’t be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless he wishes to be. Mordakhesh has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Mordakhesh makes three greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) force damage.

actions.name: Chromatic Orb
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) damage of a type chosen by Mordakhesh: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

legendary_actions.desc: Mordakhesh can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Mordakhesh regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Mordakhesh makes one weapon attack or casts chromatic orb.

legendary_actions.name: Chromatic Resistance
legendary_actions.desc: Modakhesh gains resistance to one damage type of his choice — acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder — until the start of his next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Warlord’s Command (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Mordakhesh targets up to two allies that he can see within 30 feet of him. If a target can see and hear him, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

name: Construct Spirit: Stone
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Stony Lethargy
traits.desc: When a creature the construct can see starts its turn within 10 feet of the construct, the construct can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target can't use reactions and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The construct makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level bludgeoning damage.

languages: Deep Speech, understands the languages you speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Eye Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, range 150 ft., one creature. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + the spell's level psychic damage

name: Valenar Hawk
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can’t speak

traits.name: Bonding
traits.desc: The hawk can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the hawk bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hawk and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The hawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

name: Garra
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Valenar Steed
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can’t speak

traits.name: Bonding
traits.desc: The steed can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the steed bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the steed and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

name: Hashalaq Quori
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.desc:
The quori’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: charm person

3/day each: detect thoughts, disguise self, suggestion

1/day: dominate person, dream

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quori uses its Mind Thrust twice.

actions.name: Idyllic Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall prone in a fit of laughter.

actions.name: Mind Thrust
actions.desc: The quori targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn’t deprive the target of awareness. The quori can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target’s statistics, but doesn’t gain access to the target’s knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

reactions.name: Empathic Feedback
reactions.desc: When the quori takes damage from a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, the quori can force that creature to succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Chilling Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d12 + 3 + the spell's level cold damage.

actions.name: Dreadful Scream (1/Day)
actions.desc: The spirit screams. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Shadow Stealth (Bonus Action)
actions.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the spirit takes the Hide action.

name: Bone Knight
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Commander of Bones
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the knight can target one skeleton or zombie it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must obey the knight’s commands until the knight dies or until the knight releases it as a bonus action. The knight can command up to twelve undead at a time this way.

traits.name: Master of the Pallid Banner
traits.desc: While within 60 feet of the knight, any undead ally of the knight has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The knight is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

1st level (4 slots): command, compelled duel, hellish rebuke, wrathful smite

2nd level (3 slots): branding smite, crown of madness, darkness, find steed, magic weapon

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The knight attacks twice with one of its weapons.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

name: Shifter
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Shifting (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the shifter takes on a more bestial form for 1 minute or until it dies. The shifter gains 5 temporary hit points. It can make a bite attack when it activates this trait and also as a bonus action on each of its turns while in its bestial form.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Living Lightning Bolt

damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

actions.name: Magical Strike. Melee Spell Attack:
actions.desc: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) lightning damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The living spell unleashes a stroke of lightning in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Sul Khatesh
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc:
Sul Khatesh’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 26, +18 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: counterspell, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, eyebite, fireball, lightning bolt, shield

3/day each: chain lightning, create undead, dream, hold monster, mass suggestion, scrying

1/day each: foresight, gate, power word kill, teleport

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Sul Khatesh fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Sul Khatesh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master of Magic
traits.desc: Sul Khatesh has advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Sul Khatesh makes four attacks with Arcane Blast.

actions.name: Arcane Blast
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +18 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (1d10 + 10) force damage.

actions.name: Magic Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (5d12 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Arcane Cataclysm (Recharges after a Long Rest)
actions.desc: Sul Khatesh conjures orbs of magical energy that plummet to the ground at three different points she can see within 1 mile of her. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 (11d12) force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one arcane burst is affected only once. The area of each arcane burst then acts as an antimagic field for 1 hour. Sul Khatesh and spells she casts are unaffected by these fields.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc:
Sul Khatesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than her own, or back into her true form. She reverts to her true form if she dies. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Sul Khatesh’s choice).

In a new form, Sul Khatesh retains her alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Her statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.desc: Sul Khatesh can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Sul Khatesh regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Sul Khatesh makes two attacks with her Arcane Blast or one attack with her magic staff.

legendary_actions.name: Consume Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Sul Khatesh targets a creature within 120 feet of her who is concentrating on a spell. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Constitution saving throw or its concentration is broken on the spell, and Sul Khatesh gains 5 temporary hit points per level of that spell.

legendary_actions.name: Maddening Secrets (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Sul Khatesh whispers an arcane secret into the mind of a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or expend one of its spell slots of 3rd level or lower and deal 26 (4d12) force damage to each creature within 30 feet of it. A creature that fails the saving throw but can’t expend a spell slot is instead stunned until the end of its next turn.

name: Karrnathi Undead Soldier
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The soldier has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the soldier’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the soldier to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the soldier drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The soldier attacks three times with one of its weapons.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The soldier adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the soldier must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

name: Elemental Spirit: Earth
languages: Primordial, understands the languages you speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The elemental makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d10 + 4 + the spell's level bludgeoning damage.

name: Belashyrra
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Alien Mind
traits.desc: If a creature tries to read Belashyrra’s thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Eye Thief
traits.desc: Belashyrra can see through the eyes of all creatures within 120 feet of it. It can use its Eye Ray through any creature within 120 feet of it, as though it were in that creature’s space.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Belashyrra fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Belashyrra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Belashyrra regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. Belashyrra dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

traits.name: Teleport
traits.desc: As a bonus action, Belashyrra can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Belashyrra makes two attacks with its claws and uses its Eye Ray once.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Eye Ray
actions.desc:
Belashyrra shoots one of the following magical eye rays of its choice, targeting one creature it can see within 120 feet of it:

1. Psyche-Reconstruction Ray. The target must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw, taking 49 (9d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it dies and transforms into a spectator under Belashyrra’s control and acts immediately after Belashyrra in the initiative order. The target can’t be returned to its original form by any means short of a wish spell.

2. Domination Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by Belashyrra for 1 minute or until the target takes damage. Belashyrra can issue telepathic commands to the charmed creature (no action required), which it does its best to obey.

3. Mind-Weakening Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw or take 36 (8d8) psychic damage and be unable to cast spells or activate magic items for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

4. Blinding Ray. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) radiant damage and be blinded for 1 minute. Until this blindness ends, Belyshyrra can see through the blinded creature’s eyes. The blinded creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary_actions.desc: Belashyrra can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Belashyrra regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: Belashyrra makes one claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Implant Fear (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Belashyrra targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (4d10) psychic damage and immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from Belashyrra.

legendary_actions.name: Rend Reality (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Belashyrra rips at the bonds of reality in its immediate area. Each creature within 10 feet of Belashyrra must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) force damage and gain one level of exhaustion.

name: Living Cloudkill
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Magical Strike. Melee Spell Attack:
actions.desc: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (5d6 + 5) poison damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc:
The living spell creates a 40-foot-diameter sphere of fog within 60 feet of it (the fog spreads around corners). When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fog moves 10 feet away from the living spell at the start of each of its turns, rolling along the ground and through openings. The fog lasts for 10 minutes or until the living spell’s concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The beast doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The beast makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level piercing damage.

name: The Lord of Blades
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Adamantine Plating
traits.desc: Any critical hit against the Lord of Blades becomes a normal hit.

traits.name: Bladed Armor
traits.desc: A creature that grapples the Lord of Blades or is grappled by him takes 13 (3d8) slashing damage. A creature takes 13 (3d8) slashing damage if it starts its turn grappling or being grappled by the Lord of Blades.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the Lord of Blades moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with his adamantine sixblade on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 (2d10) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:
The Lord of Blades is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following artificer spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): fire bolt (see “Actions” below), mage hand, mending, prestidigitation

1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, sanctuary, thunderwave

2nd level (3 slots): blur, heat metal, scorching ray, see invisibility

3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, fly, haste

4th level (3 slots): freedom of movement, Mordenkainen’s faithful hound

5th level (2 slots): animate objects, wall of force

traits.name: Warforged Resilience
traits.desc: The Lord of Blades has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, is immune to disease, and magic can’t put him to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Lord of Blades makes three attacks: two with his adamantine sixblade and one with his bladed wings.

actions.name: Adamantine Sixblade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

actions.name: Bladed Wings
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d10) fire damage.

legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of Blades can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Lord of Blades regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of Blades makes one weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of Blades casts one of his cantrips.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of Blades casts a spell of 2nd level or lower from his spell list that takes 1 action to cast.

legendary_actions.name: Blade Dash (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of Blades moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then makes one attack with his adamantine sixblade. He can make one bladed wings attack against each creature he moves past.

name: Construct Spirit: Clay
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The construct makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: you spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level bludgeoning damage.

reactions.desc: When the construct takes damage, it makes a slam attack against a random creature within 5 feet of it. If no creature is within reach, the construct moves up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking opportunity attacks.

name: Baba Lysaga

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: Baba Lysaga can use an action to polymorph into a swarm of insects (flies) or back into her true form. While in swarm form, she has a walking speed of 5 feet and a flying speed of 30 feet. Anything she is wearing transforms with her, but nothing she is carrying does.

traits.name: Blessing of Mother Night
traits.desc: Baba Lysaga is shielded against divination magic, as though protected by a nondetection spell.

spells: Baba Lysaga is a 16th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). Baba Lysaga has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, sleep, witch bolt
2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, enlarge/reduce, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, fireball, lightning bolt
4th level (3 slots): blight, Everard's black tentacles, polymorph
5th level (2 slots): cloudkill, geas, scrying
6th level (1 slot): programmed illusion, true seeing
7th level (1 slot): finger of death, mirage arcane
8th level (1 slot): power word stun

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) bludegoning damage, or 8 (1d8+4) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The hut deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10+8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8+8) bludegoning damage.

name: Broom of Animated Attack
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.desc: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. 	The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

reactions.desc: If the broom is motionless and a creature grabs hold of it, the broom makes a Dexterity check contested by the creature's Strength check. If the broom wins the contest, it flies out of the creature's grasp and makes a melee attack against it with advantage on the attack roll.

name: Barovian Witch
spells: The witch is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The witch has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): ray of sickness, sleep, Tasha's hideous laughter
2nd level (2 slots): alter self, invisibility

actions.name: Claws (Requires Alter Self)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage. This attack is magical.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

name: Ezmerelda d'Avenir

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: In addition to her magic armor and weapons, Ezmerelda has two potions of greater healing, six vials of holy water, and three wooden stakes.

spells: Ezmerelda is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). Ezmerelda has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): protection from good and evil, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): darkvision, knock, mirror image
3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, lightning bolt, magic circle
4th level (1 slot): greater invisibility

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Ezmerelda makes three attacks: two with her +1 rapier and one with her +1 handaxe or her silvered shortsword.

actions.name: Rapier +1
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8+5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Handaxe +1
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Silvered Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Curse (Recharges after a Long Rest)
actions.desc: Ezmerelda targets one creature that she can see within 30 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. While cursed, the target has vulnerability to one type of damage of Ezmerelda's choice. The curse lasts until ended with a greater restoration spell, a remove curse spell, or similar magic. When the curse ends, Ezmerelda takes 3d6 psychic damage.

actions.name: Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: Ezmerelda targets one creature that she can see within 10 feet of her and casts one of the following spells on the target (save DC 14), requiring neither somatic nor material components to do so: animal friendship, charm person, or hold person. If the target succeeds on the initial saving throw, Ezmerelda is blinded until the end of her next turn. Once a target succeeds on a saving throw against this effect, it is immune to the Evil Eye power of all Vistani for 24 hours.

condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

spells: The portrait's innate spellcasting ability os Intelligence (spell save DC 12). The portrait can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
3/day each: counterspell, crown of madness, hypnotic pattern, telekinesis

traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Izek hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10+4) when used with two hands.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it catches fire.

3rd level (3 slots): create food and water, speak with dead, spirit guardians
4th level (3 slots): divination, freedom of movement, guardians of faith
5th level (2 slots): greater restoration, raise dead
6th level (1 slot): find the path, harm, true seeing
7th level (1 slot): fire storm, regenerate

actions.name: Dagger

While cursed, the target is blinded and deafened. The curse lasts until ended with a greater restoration spell, a remove curse spell, or similar magic. When the curse ends, Madam Eva takes 5d6 psychic damage.
