If the target succeeds on the initial saving throw, Madam Eva is blinded until the end of her next turn. Once a target succeeds on a saving throw against this effect, it is immune to the Evil Eye power of all Vistani for 24 hours.

traits.name: Extraordinary Feature
traits.desc: The mongrelfolk has one of the following extraordinary features, determined randomly by rolling a d20 or chosen by the DM: 	 1-3 — Amphibious: The mongrelfolk can breathe air and water.  4-9 — Darkvision: The mongrelfolk has darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.  10 — Flight: The mongrelfolk has leathery wings and a flying speed of 40 feet.  11-15 — Keen Hearing and Smell: The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.  16-17 — Spider Climb: The mongrelfolk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.  18-19 — Standing Leap: The mongrelfolk's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.  20 — Two-Headed: The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The mongrelfolk can mimic any sounds it has beard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mongrelfolk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw or dagger.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.

name: Phantom Warrior
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.desc: The phantom warrior can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The phantom warrior can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Spectral Armor and Shield
traits.desc: The phantom warrior's AC accounts for its spectral armor and shield.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phantom warrior makes two attacks with its spectral longsword.

actions.name: Spectral Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) force damage.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.desc: The phantom warrior enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

name: Pidlwick II
languages: understands Common but doesn't speak and can't read or write

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.desc: During the first round of combat, Pidlwick II has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't had a turn yet.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

name: Rahadin

traits.name: Deathly Choir
traits.desc: Any creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn't protected by a mind blank spell hears in its mind the screams of the thousands of people Rahadin has killed. As a bonus action, Rahadin can force all creatures that can hear the screams to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. Each creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: Rahadin has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.desc: Rahadin can attempt to hide even when he is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

spells: Rahadin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
3/day: misty step, phantom steed
1/day: magic weapon, nondetection

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Rahadin attacks three times with his scimitar, or twice with his poisoned darts.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6+6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Poisoned Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4+6) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

name: Rictavio

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: In addition to his sword cane, Rictavio wears a hat of disguise and a ring of mind shielding, and he carries a spell scroll of raise dead.

traits.name: Undead Slayer
traits.desc: When Rictavio hits an undead with a weapon attack, the undead takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage of the weapon's type.

spells: Rictavio is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Rictavio has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, mending, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good, sanctuary
2nd level (3 slots): augury, lesser restoration, protection from poison
3rd level (3 slots): magic circle, remove curse, speak with dead
4th level (3 slots): death ward, freedom of movement
5th level (1 slot): dispel evil and good

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Rictavio makes two attacks with his sword cane.

actions.name: Sword Cane
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage (wooden cane) or piercing damage (silvered sword).

name: Strahd's Animated Armor
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Constructed Nature
traits.desc: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. 	The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The armor is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the armor must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The armor makes two melee attacks or uses Shocking Bolt twice.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Shocking Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit (with advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal), range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

name: Strahd von Zarovich
damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
languages: Abyssal, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Giant, Infernal

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: If Strahd isn't in running water or sunlight, he can use his action to polymorph into a Tiny bat, a Medium wolf, or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into his true form. 	While in bat or wolf form, Strahd can't speak. In bat form, his walking speed is 5 feet, and he has a flying speed of 30 feet. In wolf form, his walking speed is 40 feet. His statistics, other than his size and speed, are unchanged. Anything he is wearing transforms with him, but nothing he is carrying does. He reverts to his true form if he dies. 	While in mist form, Strahd can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. He is weightless, has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and he can't pass through water. He has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage he takes from sunlight.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Strahd fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Misty Escape
traits.desc: When he drops to 0 hit points outside his coffin, Strahd transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that he isn't in running water or sunlight. If he can't transform, he is destroyed. 	While he has 0 hit points in mist form, he can't revert to his vampire form, and he must reach his coffin within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in his coffin, he reverts to his vampire form. He is then paralyzed until he regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in his coffin with 0 hit points, he regains 1 hit point.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Strahd regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point and isn't in running water or sunlight. If he takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Strahd can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses
traits.desc: Strahd has the following flaws.  	Forbiddance: He can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. 	Harmed by Running Water: He takes 20 acid damage if he ends his turn in running water. 	Stake to the Heart: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into his heart while he is incapacitated in his coffin, he is paralyzed until the stake is removed. 	Sunlight Hypersensitivity: While in sunlight, Strahd takes 20 radiant damage at the start of his turn, and he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

spells: Strahd is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). Strahd has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): comprehend languages, fog cloud, sleep
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, gust of wind, mirror image
3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, fireball, nondetection
4th level (3 slots): blight, greater invisibility, polymorph
5th level (1 slot): animate objects, scrying

actions.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
actions.desc: Strahd makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) bludgeoning damage, plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, Strahd can grapple it (escape DC 18) instead of dealing the bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by Strahd, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and Strahd regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if  its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under Strahd's control.

actions.name: Charm
actions.desc: Strahd targets one humanoid he can see within 30 ft. of him. If the target can see Strahd, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed. The charmed target regards Strahd as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. The target isn't under Strahd's control, but it takes Strahd's requests and actions in the most favorable way and lets Strahd bite it. 	Each time Strahd or his companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until Strahd is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

actions.name: Children of the Night (1/day)
actions.desc: Strahd magically calls 2d4 swarms of bats or swarms rats, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, Strahd can call 3d6 wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of Strahd and obeying his spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until Strahd dies, or until he dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary_actions.desc: Strahd can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Strahd regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: Strahd moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Unarmed Strike
legendary_actions.desc: Strahd makes one unarmed strike.

legendary_actions.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Strahd makes one bite attack.

name: Strahd Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Loathsome Limbs
traits.desc: Whenever the zombie takes at least 5 bludgeoning or slashing damage at one time, roll a d20 to determine what else happens to it:   1-8: One leg is severed from the zombie if it has any legs left.  9-16: One arm is severed from the zombie if it has any arms left.  17-20: The zombie is decapitated.  	If the zombie is reduced to 0 hit points, all parts of it die. Until then, a severed part acts on the zombie's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 8. Any damage it takes is subtracted from the zombie's hit points. 	A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of 5 feet. 	A severed arm has a speed of 5 feet and can make one claw attack on its turn, with disadvantage on the attack roll. Each time the zombie loses an arm, it loses a claw attack. 	If its head is severed, the zombie loses its bite attack and its body is blinded unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 0 feet. It can make a bite attack but only against a target in its space. 	The zombie's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls prone. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zombie makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage.

name: Tree Blight
languages: understands Common and Druidic but doesn't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead tree.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The blight deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blight makes four attacks: two with its branches and two with its grasping roots, If it has a target grappled, the blight can also make a bite attack against the target as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Branch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Grasping Root
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature not grappled by the blight. Hit: the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 9 (1d6+6) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 15 and can be severed by dealing 6 slashing damage or more to it at once. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the blight but ends the grapple.

name: Vladimir Horngaard
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Vladimir regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Vladimir's body is destroyed only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When Vladimir's body is destroyed, his soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: Vladimir is immune to effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Vengeful Tracker
traits.desc: Vladimir knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and Vladimir are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by Vladimir dies, Vladimir knows.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Vladimir makes two fist attacks or two attacks with his +2 Greatsword.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which Vladimir has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, Vladimir can grapple the target (escape DC 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

actions.name: Greatsword +2
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (4d6+4) slashing damage. Against Strahd, Vladimir deals an extra 14 (4d6) slashing damage with this weapon.

actions.name: Vengeful Glare
actions.desc: Vladimir targets one creature he can see within 30 feet of him and against which he has sworn vengeance. The target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until Vladimir deals damage to it, or until the end of Vladimir's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of Vladimir for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see Vladimir, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

name: Wereraven
speed: 30 ft., fly 50 ft. in raven and hybrid forms
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The wereraven can use its action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into its human form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its human form if it dies.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The wereraven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Multiattack (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The wereraven makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its hand crossbow.

actions.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

actions.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

name: Brainstealer dragon (The Illithidragon)
senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 23

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: the brainstealer dragon (the illithidragon) has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the brainstealer dragon (the illithidragon) fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc: The brainstealer dragon (the illithidragon)'s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only somatic components: At will: levitate, detect thoughts

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The brainstealer dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its tentacles and two with its claws.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 18) and must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends. (each round its gets dragged 5ft towards the Brainstealer)

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 62 (10d10 + 0) piercing damage. Has to be one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the brainstealer dragon. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the brainstealer dragon kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. Hit: 61 (12d8 + 7) psychic damage. The brainstealer dragon magically emits psychic energy in a 60 ft. cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence saving throw or take 54 (12d8) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Psychic Domination 1/day (Concentration 1 minute)
actions.desc: As a Bonus action, The  Brainstealer dragon targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target much succeeds on a Dc 20 Intelligence saving throw, or the  Brainstealer dragon chooses the creature's actions and movement on its turns until the  Brainstealer dragon concentration ends. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw ending its effect on a success. A creature is immune to this ability if it is immune to being charmed

actions.name: Psychic Grip 1/day (Concentration) 1 minute)
actions.desc: As a bonus action, the  Brainstealer dragon targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Dc 20 intelligence saving throw or paralysed until the  Brainstealer dragon concentration ends. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw ending its effect on a success. Brainstealer dragon can use it as a reaction to force the target to move up to half its speed, even though it's paralyzed.

actions.name: Frightful presence
actions.desc: Each creature of the brainstealer dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle
legendary_actions.desc: Brainstealer dragon make one attack with it's Tentacles

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: Brainstealer dragon make one claw attack

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the herrscher of void fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Vacuum Breath
traits.desc: Herrscher of Void doesn’t require air.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Herrscher of Void can use her Frightful Presence. She then makes four attacks: one with her bite, two with her claws, and one with her tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of Herrscher of Void's choice that is within 120 feet of her and can see it must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Herrscher of Void's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Void Blast
actions.desc: Herrscher of Void exhales void radiation in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 90 (20d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: Herrscher of Void makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Herrscher of Void makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Force Blast
legendary_actions.desc: Herrscher of Void claps her hands. Each within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage and be pushed 15 feet in a straight line away from Herrshcer of Void. Herrscher of Void can then fly up to half its flying speed.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.desc: If the atrociraptor moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the atrociraptor can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.desc: The dragon makes 3 attacks. 1 with it's bite, and 2 with it's claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons

actions.name: Acid Breath. Exhales acid in an 40-foot line, 5 feet wide. Each creature makes a DC 14 Dex save throw, taking 40 (9d8) damage on a failed save, or half damage on a success.
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack:, range 40, one target. Hit: 44 (9d8 + 4) acid damage.

actions.name: Slowing breath. The dragon exhales a gas in a 30 ft cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save.
